Hi Noah,
=C2=A0
Need your help in validating the way I am currently reading=
 the records from my Arc file. I assume this is the root cause why the char=
acter encoding is not preserved when the data is stored into database
=C2=
=A0
public static String storeArc(ARCReader reader) {
=C2=A0
=C2=A0String a=
rcRecordContent =3D "";
=C2=A0reader.setParseHttpHeaders(true);
=C2=A0Itera=
tor<ArchiveRecord> iterator =3D reader.iterator();
=C2=A0
=C2=A0/** 
=C2=A0=
 * Skip the header record of Arc file
=C2=A0 */
=C2=A0if(iterator.hasNext()=
)
=C2=A0=C2=A0iterator.next();
=C2=A0while(iterator.hasNext()) {
=C2=A0=C2=
=A0 
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 ARCRecord record =3D (ARCRecord) iterator.next();
=
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 ARCRecordMetaData header =3D record.getMetaData();
=C2=
=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 record.skipHttpHeader();
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 ByteArrayOutput=
Stream baos =3D new ByteArrayOutputStream();
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 record.dump=
(baos);
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 byte[] content =3D baos.toByteArray();
=C2=A0=C2=
=A0=C2=A0 arcRecordContent =3D content.toString();
=C2=A0=C2=A0 }=C2=A0=C2=
=A0
}
=C2=A0
After the thread: http://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/archive-c=
rawler/conversations/topics/3984=C2=A0, it appears that the issue is with t=
he code that is underlined above.
=C2=A0
Please advise.
=C2=A0
~Arin
=C2=A0=




On Tuesday, December 17, 2013 11:43 PM, Arin Patel Itha <iarinpatel@yah=
oo.com> wrote:
  
Hey Noah,
You are correct, it's the issue with
my file ed=
itor. TextPad is
translating all the Japanese characters into ?. When I ope=
n the Arc file in
Notepad I am able to see the right data. I did not think =
about it since the Arc
data that was loaded into my database also missing t=
he original Japanese text.
In my programs, I am using org.archive.io.arc.AR=
CReader,
org.archive.io.arc.ARCRecord and other classes to load the records=
 from Arc file and store it
into my database. The database has UTF-8 encodi=
ng settings
but still there is an information loss.
I will investigate more=
 on this and
let you know for further assistance.
Thanks for your help so f=
ar.
~Ravi

rchive.org> wrote:
  
=C2=A0 
Arin,=C2=A0

I tried crawling that page and w=
riting to arc, and it worked fine. Is it possible the file got mangled by y=
our text editor or something? If not, maybe you can try the latest build fr=
om http://builds.archive.org/maven2/org/archive/heritrix/heritrix/3.2.0-SNA=
PSHOT/. If the problem persists you might want to debug it yourself since I=
 can't seem to reproduce it. 

Noah
